org.waarp.gateway.kernel.rest

Class RestArgument

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.waarp.gateway.kernel.rest.RestArgument

  • public class RestArgument
extends Object
    Rest object that contains all arguments or answers once all tasks are over:
    - ARG_HASBODY, ARG_METHOD, ARG_PATH, ARG_BASEPATH, ARGS_SUBPATH, ARG_X_AUTH_KEY, ARG_X_AUTH_USER, ARG_X_AUTH_TIMESTAMP, ARG_X_AUTH_ROLE: root elements (query only)
    - ARG_METHOD, ARG_PATH, ARG_BASEPATH, ARGS_SUBPATH, ARG_X_AUTH_USER, JSON_STATUSMESSAGE, JSON_STATUSCODE, JSON_COMMAND: root elements (answer only)
    - ARGS_URI: uri elements (query only)
    - ARGS_HEADER: header elements (query only)
    - ARG_COOKIE: cookie elements
    - ARGS_BODY: body elements (query only)
    - ARGS_ANSWER: answer part (answer only)

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAnswer(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode node)

      void addIdToUriArgs() 
      void addOptions(String allow, String path, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ArrayNode detailedAllow)
      Add options in answer
      void addResult(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode result) 
      void addSubUriToUriArgs(String name, int rank) 
      void checkBaseAuthent(HmacSha256 hmacSha256, String extraKey, long maxInterval)
      This implementation of authentication is as follow: if X_AUTH is included in the URI or Header
      0) Check that timestamp is correct (|curtime - timestamp| < maxinterval) from ARG_X_AUTH_TIMESTAMP, if maxInterval is 0, not mandatory
      1) Get all URI args (except ARG_X_AUTH_KEY itself, but including timestamp), lowered case, in alphabetic order
      2) Add an extra Key if not null (from ARG_X_AUTH_INTERNALKEY)
      3) Compute an hash (SHA-1 or SHA-256)
      4) Compare this hash with ARG_X_AUTH_KEY
      void checkTime(long maxInterval)
      Check Time only (no signature)
      void clean()
      Clean all internal values

      • getBaseAuthent

        public static String[] getBaseAuthent(HmacSha256 hmacSha256,
                                      io.netty.handler.codec.http.QueryStringEncoder encoder,
                                      String user,
                                      String extraKey)
                               throws HttpInvalidAuthenticationException
        The encoder is completed with extra necessary URI part containing ARG_X_AUTH_TIMESTAMP & ARG_X_AUTH_KEY
        Parameters:
        hmacSha256 - SHA-256 key to create the signature
        encoder -
        user - might be null
        extraKey - might be null
        Returns:
        an array of 2 value in order ARG_X_AUTH_TIMESTAMP and ARG_X_AUTH_KEY
        Throws:
        HttpInvalidAuthenticationException - if the computation of the authentication failed

      • checkTime

        public void checkTime(long maxInterval)
               throws HttpInvalidAuthenticationException
        Check Time only (no signature)
        Parameters:
        maxInterval -
        Throws:
        HttpInvalidAuthenticationException

      • checkBaseAuthent

        public void checkBaseAuthent(HmacSha256 hmacSha256,
                             String extraKey,
                             long maxInterval)
                      throws HttpInvalidAuthenticationException
        This implementation of authentication is as follow: if X_AUTH is included in the URI or Header
        0) Check that timestamp is correct (|curtime - timestamp| < maxinterval) from ARG_X_AUTH_TIMESTAMP, if maxInterval is 0, not mandatory
        1) Get all URI args (except ARG_X_AUTH_KEY itself, but including timestamp), lowered case, in alphabetic order
        2) Add an extra Key if not null (from ARG_X_AUTH_INTERNALKEY)
        3) Compute an hash (SHA-1 or SHA-256)
        4) Compare this hash with ARG_X_AUTH_KEY
        Parameters:
        hmacSha256 - SHA-256 key to create the signature
        extraKey - will be added as ARG_X_AUTH_INTERNALKEY might be null
        maxInterval - ARG_X_AUTH_TIMESTAMP will be tested if value > 0
        Throws:
        HttpInvalidAuthenticationException - if the authentication failed

      • computeKey

        protected static String computeKey(HmacSha256 hmacSha256,

        Parameters:
        hmacSha256 - SHA-256 key to create the signature
        extraKey - might be null
        treeMap -
        argPath -
        Throws:
        HttpInvalidAuthenticationException
